description: [{"region": "South Asia", "descrpition": "First winter snowfall: the Kashmir Valley received 25–38 cm of snow, ending a long dry spell with precipitation 79 % below normal"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Daytime temperatures were 4–5 °C above the February average, with many areas experiencing unusually hot conditions"}, {"region": "New England", "descrpition": "A milder start to February; maximum temperature reached 40 °F (about 5 °F above normal) and wind gusts peaked at 25 mph; the 2‑inch snow cover began to melt"}, {"region": "Southern Cone", "descrpition": "A heatwave struck early in the month; Uruguay experienced maximum temperatures between 34 °C and 38 °C with minimums of 21–24 °C"}, {"region": "Northern Europe", "descrpition": "Storm Ingunn deepened to a central pressure of 940 hPa and produced gusts of 80–100 mph along Norway’s west coast"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "February began with very hot conditions; Perth reached 40 °C for one of seven times this month"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "A low‑pressure area near Mindanao produced moderate to heavy rain and thunderstorms over northern and southeastern areas"}, {"region": "West Africa", "descrpition": "A humid heatwave gripped the Guinea coastal zone; temperatures exceeded 40 °C and the heat index approached 50 °C"}, {"region": "California Coast", "descrpition": "A powerful atmospheric river produced a peak wind gust of 102 mph in the North Bay mountains"}, {"region": "Southern South America", "descrpition": "Another day of extreme heat; Uruguay’s interior recorded highs near 38 °C as a warm air mass remained over the region"}, {"region": "Northern Europe", "descrpition": "At Sklinna Lighthouse a gust of 115 mph was recorded during Ingunn, one of the strongest storms in decades"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Another hot day saw Perth’s temperature again reach near 40 °C during a prolonged heatwave"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Forecasts warned of up to 40 cm of snow in the northern Kanto region and 30 cm around Hakone and Tama"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Abnormally hot conditions persisted due to above‑average temperatures"}, {"region": "Central California", "descrpition": "The same storm delivered winds of 80–90 mph along the Big Sur coast and intense rainfall that overwhelmed creeks"}, {"region": "Southern South America", "descrpition": "High temperatures persisted; maxima between 34 °C and 38 °C continued across much of Uruguay"}, {"region": "Southern Britain", "descrpition": "February was extremely wet; some areas recorded three times their average rainfall"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Widespread high temperatures continued; mean maximum temperatures were several degrees above normal"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Snow bands continued; up to 30 cm of snow was predicted in mountain areas and 8 cm in Tokyo’s wards"}, {"region": "West Africa", "descrpition": "Dangerous heat continued; the heat index locally reached 60 °C, entering the ‘extreme danger’ category"}, {"region": "Death Valley Desert", "descrpition": "The atmospheric river brought 1.5 inches of rain between 4–7 February, remarkable for an area that averages about 2 inches per year"}, {"region": "Southern South America", "descrpition": "The warm spell extended to 4 February with daytime temperatures still above 34 °C"}, {"region": "East Anglia", "descrpition": "The region recorded its wettest and warmest February on record with above‑average rainfall and mild temperatures"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "The hot spell persisted; daytime maxima across the region stayed near or above 40 °C"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Heavy snow peaked with around 8 cm in central Tokyo and about 30 cm in Hakone according to meteorological forecasts"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Drought intensified across Angola, Namibia, Zambia and Mozambique as rainfall deficits from the previous months persisted"}, {"region": "Desert Mountains", "descrpition": "Snow fell down to about 4 000 ft elevation in Death Valley National Park, leaving snow‑capped peaks"}, {"region": "Central South America", "descrpition": "Heat intensified; Buenos Aires saw temperatures climbing toward 35 °C during a February heatwave"}, {"region": "Northern UK", "descrpition": "Heavy rain caused flooding in the Highlands early in the month"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Perth again recorded 40 °C, continuing its run of seven 40‑degree days during February"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Snowfall gradually tapered off but remained significant, with forecasts still showing 30 cm in mountains and 8 cm in urban Tokyo"}, {"region": "Central Africa", "descrpition": "Heavy rainfall drove high river levels in the southern Congo River basin and north‑western Angola"}, {"region": "Southern Great Plains", "descrpition": "A winter storm delivered 1–3 inches of snow across the far north‑west, where temperatures were just below freezing"}, {"region": "Central South America", "descrpition": "Continued hot weather across northern Argentina and Paraguay with daytime highs near 35 °C"}, {"region": "Northern Britain", "descrpition": "Cold Arctic air between 6–8 February led to widespread rain, snow and ice; Kirkwall in Orkney measured 15 cm of snow"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Heat eased slightly but daily highs remained above 35 °C across the region"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "The Kanto region’s snow cover reached 30 cm in Hakone while Tokyo retained about 8 cm of snow; freezing rain led to icy conditions"}, {"region": "Madagascar", "descrpition": "Heavy rain from lingering cyclone remnants caused widespread flooding and additional rainfall was expected"}, {"region": "Southern Great Plains", "descrpition": "Heavy snow bands produced rates up to 1 inch per hour and left 4–6 inches of snow across parts of the region"}, {"region": "Northern South America", "descrpition": "Temperatures in Rio de Janeiro exceeded 42 °C and heat‑index values approached 60 °C during the regional heatwave"}, {"region": "Northern Britain", "descrpition": "Snow showers continued, with 15 cm lying snow reported in Orkney and frosty nights across northern areas"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "Ex‑Tropical Cyclone Lincoln began bringing heavy rain; Centre Island recorded 202 mm of rain in 24 hours"}]

[{"region": "South Asia", "descrpition": "Dry conditions returned to the Himalayan foothills; precipitation during the prior months had been 79 % below normal"}, {"region": "East Africa", "descrpition": "Floods persisted in eastern DRC, southern Tanzania, northern Zambia and Burundi following weeks of heavy rain"}, {"region": "Southern Great Plains", "descrpition": "Additional snowfall totals of 3.5–6.5 inches were recorded across the southern portion of the region as the storm exited eastward"}, {"region": "Northern South America", "descrpition": "High humidity kept the heat index near 60 °C in parts of Brazil while air temperatures stayed above 40 °C"}, {"region": "Southern Britain", "descrpition": "While the north saw snow, southern regions experienced continuous heavy rain; some locations received three times their normal rainfall"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "Rainfall totals of 80–140 mm were forecast as the tropical low tracked across the Northern Territory"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "Early‑season heat emerged; temperatures in many areas of Indonesia, Myanmar, Thailand and Viet Nam rose into the high 30s °C, well above seasonal averages"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "The prolonged heatwave kept temperatures well above normal across Botswana, South Africa and Namibia"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Cold, windy conditions were observed; Blue Hill Observatory reported wind gusts up to 50 mph and 4.3 inches of new snow, with a snow depth of 4 inches"}, {"region": "Western Amazon Basin", "descrpition": "Elevated temperatures and dry conditions contributed to high wildfire intensity in the Amazon rainforest"}, {"region": "Southern England", "descrpition": "Persistent rain soaked railway embankments and fields; the month remained mild but often wet"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "Tennant Creek measured 138.4 mm of rain by Sunday morning during the event"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "Persistent hot weather continued with daytime temperatures regularly exceeding 35 °C across several countries"}, {"region": "West Africa", "descrpition": "High temperatures exceeded 40 °C during the early‑season heatwave; meteorological agencies issued heat warnings"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Under sunny skies the next day, the temperature at Blue Hill climbed to 35 °F, winds gusted to 31 mph and no new snow was measured"}, {"region": "Northern Amazon", "descrpition": "Prolonged drought and heat led to the highest carbon emissions for February since at least 2003 in Roraima"}, {"region": "Central England", "descrpition": "On 15 February Pershore and Teddington recorded a maximum temperature of 18.1 °C, indicating a springlike warmth"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "Rain bands continued to deliver 60–100 mm of rain across inland areas as the system moved west"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Warm air masses lifted temperatures in southern and eastern China and Japan to record‑breaking levels for February"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Large parts of the Sahel and West Africa set new monthly temperature records amid the heatwave"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "A breezy day followed; average wind speed was 19 mph with a peak gust of 47 mph; light precipitation of 0.03 inches yielded 0.4 inches of new snow"}, {"region": "Northern South America", "descrpition": "The heatwave extended into Venezuela and Bolivia with temperatures in the high 30s °C"}, {"region": "Southern England", "descrpition": "Mild and wet weather continued, with high temperatures around 18 °C and saturated ground"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Following the rain, Carnarvon recorded a scorching 49.9 °C on 18 February, a new station record"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "In southern Laos, the station at Saravanh recorded 38.2 °C (average February maximum ~31–32 °C)"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Continued extreme heat saw daytime temperatures several degrees above the long‑term mean across Zambia and Zimbabwe"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Light snow showers deposited only a trace of snow; temperatures rose from mid‑20s to low 30s °F and the peak wind gust was 14 mph"}, {"region": "Western South America", "descrpition": "Lima and coastal Peru experienced high temperatures near 31 °C with heat index values above 33 °C"}, {"region": "Northern Europe", "descrpition": "A European low named Louis on 22 February brought further rain and strong winds across northern France, the Netherlands and into southern England"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "The heatwave peaked with Carnarvon’s 49.9 °C reading and continued to bring temperatures above 48 °C for several days"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Daytime highs again climbed into the upper 30s °C across parts of China and Japan, setting new local February records"}, {"region": "West Africa", "descrpition": "Heat index values around 50 °C persisted, causing discomfort during the Africa Cup of Nations matches"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Partly cloudy skies with southwest winds averaging 18 mph and a peak gust of 39 mph; maximum temperature reached 34 °F and snow depth was 3 inches"}, {"region": "Western South America", "descrpition": "Another hot day saw Peruvian coastal cities feeling heat indices of 33–34 °C due to absent Pacific anticyclone"}, {"region": "Southern England", "descrpition": "More heavy rain on 22 February led to widespread standing water as the already‑saturated ground couldn’t absorb more moisture"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Temperatures remained extreme with many locations experiencing four successive days above 48 °C from 17–20 February"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "Minimum overnight temperatures remained well above average, with tropical nights adding to the heat stress"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Drought conditions remained, with rainfall well below normal in western Zambia and central Mozambique"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "A mostly sunny day; the high temperature was in the mid‑30s °F with wind gusts to 28 mph and a snow depth of 3 inches"}, {"region": "Western South America", "descrpition": "Temperatures remained elevated across Peru and Ecuador with highs around 31–33 °C"}, {"region": "Western Europe", "descrpition": "Throughout February much of Europe (except the north) experienced average temperatures at least 2 °C above normal"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Another day of extreme heat; daytime highs exceeded 48 °C as the heatwave persisted"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "Severe heat persisted; daily maxima across Indonesia, Thailand and Viet Nam stayed in the high 30s °C"}, {"region": "Central Africa", "descrpition": "Further heavy rain kept river levels high across the southern Congo Basin and north‑western Angola"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Cool but sunny weather continued; highs remained in the low‑to‑mid 30s °F with light winds (peak gust 22 mph) and a snow depth of 2 inches"}, {"region": "Northern South America", "descrpition": "Sticky, hot conditions persisted in coastal Brazil; air temperatures stayed above 40 °C"}, {"region": "Central and south‑eastern Europe", "descrpition": "February temperatures were 4–6 °C above normal, making the month likely one of the warmest on record"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Severe heat warnings remained in force as maximum temperatures stayed well above 45 °C"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Warmth spread, with many locations breaking February temperature records as highs exceeded 35 °C"}, {"region": "Madagascar", "descrpition": "More heavy rain threatened to worsen flooding as remnants of Tropical Cyclone Eleanor lingered along the coast"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Fair weather day with a high of 38 °F and a low of 24 °F; peak wind gust around 18 mph; no new precipitation; snow depth 2 inches"}, {"region": "Southern Cone", "descrpition": "High pressure near the South Atlantic kept Uruguay and eastern Argentina under hot, stable conditions with highs around 35–38 °C"}, {"region": "South‑eastern Europe", "descrpition": "Late‑month warm spell saw daily maxima reach 20 °C or more across regions from southeastern Poland to the northern Balkans"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Later in the month, Emu Creek station recorded 49.1 °C on 22 February"}]

[{"region": "South Asia", "descrpition": "The Himalayan foothills remained dry; weather agencies anticipated above‑average precipitation later in the month"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Heat continued unabated; temperatures remained 4–5 °C above average"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Another calm day saw temperatures near 38 °F with dew points in the low 20s and light onshore winds around 5 mph"}, {"region": "Central South America", "descrpition": "Daily maxima remained in the mid‑30s °C across Paraguay and central Argentina"}, {"region": "Eastern Central Europe", "descrpition": "On 24 February daily maxima exceeded 20 °C in southern Romania and northern Bulgaria, more than 14 °C above normal"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Even after the peak, daily highs remained in the mid‑40s °C; the region experienced its most intense February heat on record"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "The heatwave intensified; Saravanh’s 38.2 °C reading stood out against an average maximum of 31–32 °C"}, {"region": "West Africa", "descrpition": "High temperatures above 40 °C and dangerous humidity persisted through mid‑month"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "The clear weather persisted with highs around the mid‑30s °F and snow cover slowly diminishing"}, {"region": "Eastern South America", "descrpition": "Rio de Janeiro continued to record air temperatures above 42 °C and very high humidex values"}, {"region": "Eastern Europe", "descrpition": "Lviv in western Ukraine set a new February record of 17.8 °C during the warm spell"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Perth’s run of 40 °C days contributed to the state’s exceptional heatwave"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Records continued to fall as temperatures in southern China and Japan climbed above 35 °C"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Persistent drought left soils parched in Angola, Namibia and Botswana"}, {"region": "South‑central United States", "descrpition": "Record warmth developed late in the month; many stations broke daily high temperature records, with Killeen/Fort Hood reaching 100 °F (37.8 °C)"}, {"region": "Western Amazon", "descrpition": "Dry, hot air masses raised temperatures and maintained high fire potential across the Amazon basin"}, {"region": "Southern Europe", "descrpition": "Minimum overnight temperatures remained high for late winter, often 5–10 °C and sometimes above 10 °C"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "Moisture from the remnant tropical system moved into Western Australia, delivering further rainfall of 60–100 mm"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "Another day of high‑30s heat across Myanmar, Philippines and Thailand, well above seasonal norms"}, {"region": "Central Africa", "descrpition": "Heavy rains maintained elevated water levels in rivers across the Congo Basin"}, {"region": "Central United States", "descrpition": "On 26 February about 78 locations tied or broke record high temperatures as a dry and warm air mass dominated"}, {"region": "Southern Cone", "descrpition": "Mid‑month heat eased only slightly; daytime highs remained in the low 30s °C across Uruguay"}, {"region": "Mediterranean region", "descrpition": "A low‑pressure system named Dorothea drew warm subtropical air from North Africa into eastern central Europe, boosting temperatures"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "Flash‑flood advisories remained as ex‑Tropical Cyclone Lincoln’s remnants continued to drop heavy rain"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Warmth persisted with daytime maxima around 35 °C and nights staying unusually warm"}, {"region": "Madagascar", "descrpition": "Episodes of torrential rain continued along the east coast, keeping flood risk high"}, {"region": "Central United States", "descrpition": "The following day another 69 stations tied or broke record highs; overnight minimum temperatures were also exceptionally high"}, {"region": "Western South America", "descrpition": "Coastal Peru continued to see highs near 31–32 °C with heat indices above 33 °C"}, {"region": "Western Europe", "descrpition": "Early February remained mild in the south under high pressure while heavy rain continued in the north"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Heat eased slightly near month‑end but temperatures remained above seasonal normals"}]

[{"region": "South Asia", "descrpition": "Precipitation increased modestly toward month‑end following a long dry spell, but snow remained scarce"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Abnormally hot conditions spread across southern Africa, with many areas experiencing record warmth"}, {"region": "Southern Plains", "descrpition": "Overnight lows remained around 70 °F (21.1 °C) at Houston during the record‑breaking heat event"}, {"region": "Northern South America", "descrpition": "Temperatures stayed around 40 °C in parts of Brazil with humidity making conditions feel oppressive"}, {"region": "Northern Britain", "descrpition": "During the cold spell early in the month, widespread ice accompanied the snowfall"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "The month concluded with more days over 40 °C in Perth, highlighting the persistence of the heatwave"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "The heat episode eased slightly yet highs remained above 33 °C in many regions"}, {"region": "West Africa", "descrpition": "The early‑season heatwave gradually eased but daytime temperatures remained above 35 °C"}, {"region": "Western North America", "descrpition": "Following the heatwave, more seasonal and much colder weather returned as February drew to a close"}, {"region": "Southern South America", "descrpition": "After a brief respite, temperatures in Uruguay and Buenos Aires climbed back toward 35 °C"}, {"region": "Southern Britain", "descrpition": "Persistent rain kept river levels high; dozens of roads were deluged by water by 22 February"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Severe heatwave warnings persisted as central Western Australia remained under excessive heat"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "High‑latitude Asia saw milder conditions compared with earlier in the month, though temperatures stayed above average"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "Heat persisted; daytime maxima stayed several degrees above the February climatology"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Near the end of the month, temperatures moderated with daytime highs around 35 °F and remaining snow cover around 1–2 inches"}, {"region": "Northern Amazon", "descrpition": "Heat and drought persisted, maintaining wildfire risk despite some localized showers"}, {"region": "Central and eastern Europe", "descrpition": "Throughout February average temperatures were 2–3 °C above normal, contributing to an unusually mild winter"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "Isolated thunderstorms brought additional rain but totals remained below the earlier 202 mm deluge"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "Late‑month temperatures still reached the low 30s °C, maintaining above‑normal warmth"}, {"region": "Central Africa", "descrpition": "Rain‑soaked ground and high river levels continued in the southern Congo Basin"}, {"region": "Northeastern U.S.", "descrpition": "Late‑month skies were partly cloudy; wind speeds were light and temperatures hovered in the mid‑30s °F"}, {"region": "Central South America", "descrpition": "Late‑month warmth kept daily highs in the low‑to‑mid 30s °C across Argentina and Paraguay"}, {"region": "Northern Europe", "descrpition": "The contrast between cold northern latitudes and warm southern regions was pronounced, with some areas 4–6 °C warmer than average"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "Even late in the month, Carnarvon and adjacent towns reported daytime highs near 45 °C"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "Mild late‑February weather persisted; daytime maxima were several degrees above long‑term averages"}, {"region": "Madagascar", "descrpition": "Although rainfall eased slightly, earlier downpours left much of the island saturated"}, {"region": "Great Plains", "descrpition": "Dry conditions prevailed between storms; daytime highs were above freezing and no new precipitation fell"}, {"region": "Western South America", "descrpition": "Coastal Peru’s temperature and humidex gradually declined but remained above seasonal normals"}, {"region": "Western Europe", "descrpition": "February was one of the warmest or warmest months on record for many locations, with mild nights and springlike days"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "The heatwave eased gradually though maxima stayed above 35 °C across much of Western Australia"}]

[{"region": "South Asia", "descrpition": "Final days of the month remained dry but warmer than average, with early‑spring temperatures rising"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "The month closed with continued warmth; temperatures were still above average across the region"}, {"region": "Pacific Northwest", "descrpition": "After the early‑month bomb cyclone, conditions improved with lower wind speeds and reduced rainfall"}, {"region": "Northern South America", "descrpition": "End‑of‑month heat remained with air temperatures around 38–40 °C and high humidity in Brazil"}, {"region": "South‑eastern Europe", "descrpition": "Minimum temperatures of 5–10 °C near month‑end meant frost was largely absent"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "February closed with another hot day; Perth recorded a high above 40 °C yet again"}]

[{"region": "Southeast Asia", "descrpition": "The month closed with continued warmth; highs around 32–34 °C were recorded across many areas"}, {"region": "West Africa", "descrpition": "End‑of‑month conditions were still hot, with daytime highs near 35–38 °C and sticky humidity"}, {"region": "Southwestern U.S.", "descrpition": "The Death Valley temporary lake persisted due to previous rainfall; snow remained on mountains after the 4 000‑ft snowfall"}, {"region": "Southern Cone", "descrpition": "February ended with another round of high temperatures, with maxima near 35–38 °C in Uruguay and eastern Argentina"}, {"region": "Central Europe", "descrpition": "The month concluded with high temperatures around 20 °C in late February due to warm subtropical air"}, {"region": "Northern Australia", "descrpition": "After earlier heavy rain, weather conditions became drier with only scattered showers and moderate temperatures"}]

[{"region": "East Asia", "descrpition": "February ended with temperatures above normal; many locations experienced one of their warmest late‑winter days"}, {"region": "Southern Africa", "descrpition": "February ended with above‑normal heat across Botswana, Namibia and South Africa, capping a record‑hot month"}, {"region": "Central United States", "descrpition": "February ended with colder weather following the record heat, as a cold front replaced the warm air mass"}, {"region": "Amazon Basin", "descrpition": "The month closed with continued elevated temperatures and dry soils across the northern Amazon"}, {"region": "Northern UK", "descrpition": "The month ended wet and windy as further low‑pressure systems brought rain and strong winds to the region"}, {"region": "Western Australia", "descrpition": "The month ended with the region’s exceptional heatwave still evident, having delivered multiple days above 48 °C"}]
